page.title: 03Environmental impact, Derby
page.content: The Rolls Royce complex at Sinfin has had a profound effect on the environment. Vast areas of farmland have been lost to works, yards and huge car parks. New roads have been constructed which have and will swallow up land, especially when the spur from the Derby-Stoke link road is built into Allenton, to serve the industries. Local people now complain about the almost continuous noise from the aero-engine test beds, whilst the odour of fuel fumes can be detected over one kilometre downwind of the works. An additional effect of the works can be experienced at 08.30 and 16.00, when the car parks empty and the roads become totally congested.
